question_stem:
Consider the following qqplot:

QQ-plot of data

Which of the following datasets corresponds to it?

possible histograms of data

items.part_stem_html:
Consider the following qqplot:

QQ-plot of data

possible histograms of data
items.solution:
The qq-plot indicates that the original data has a fatter tail on the right but thinner (than Normal) tail on the left. This histogram has thinner tails on both sides, so it is not the answer.

The qq-plot indicates that the original data has a fatter tail on the right but thinner (than Normal) tail on the left. The histogram also has this property, so this is indeed the right answer.

The qq-plot indicates that the original data has a fatter tail on the right but thinner (than Normal) tail on the left. However this histogram has a thinner right tail and a fatter left tail.

The qq-plot indicates that the original data has a fatter tail on the right but thinner (than Normal) tail on the left. This histogram actually looks close to Normal; it would not result in such a qq-plot.
